sndlib.core.problem
Class LinkFlow

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.problem.LinkFlow

public class LinkFlow
extends java.lang.Object

A LinkFlow is used to represent the flow on a single link in a network with respect to a specific solution.

It provides a positive and a negative flow component depending on the direction into which the flow runs. If the link model of the network design problem is DIRECTED, then there is only a positive flow. If it is UNDIRECTED, no direction is taken into account. For a BIDIRECTED link model the flow in each direction has to be considered separately.

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
Link, SolvedProblem
